bibl.title: K. ʿAnqāʾ mughrib
كتاب عنقاء مغرب
K. ʿAnqāʾ mughrib fī maʿrifa khatm al-awliyāʾ wa shams al-maghrib
The Fabulous Gryphon
bibl.author: Ibn al-ʿArabī

noteGrp.note: Written after a vision in 595H, this work is devoted to bringing out the role of the mahdī – the “rightly guided leader” – and the Seal of the Saints (whom he identifies with Jesus), discussing both a prophetic aspect which looks to the unfolding of their functions in time, and a mystical aspect which understands them as realities which can be realised in the heart of the complete human being.

bibl.note: Verified by at least four historic mss. The best is Berlin Oct. 3266 (described by Gerald Elmore in Islamic Sainthood in the Fullness of Time (Leiden, 1999) pp. 197-199), which was written in 597H, and is the oldest known ms. of IA’s. Also excellent is Private 1, written in 637H by a well-known disciple, Muḥammad b. ʿAbd al-Qādir al-Anṣāri, in Damascus and checked against the original in IA’s hand; however, according to Abrar Ahmed Shahi, who has prepared a critical edition of the text, this mss contains only about 50% of the work. Another early copy, dated 707H in the Turkish catalogue (http://ktp.isam.org.tr/), is Veliyuddin 1743 ff.1-79. Another copy, dated 834H, in Milli Hk 15 ff.12b-43b, is available in digital reproduction here: https://www.yazmalar.gov.tr/detay_goster.php?k=77129 JC notes that most of the poems from ʿAnqāʾ mughrib are also found as a block – and as complete poems – in the Dīwān, p. 26-33.
